Package example_initial_conditions

Initial conditions for examples It can fill an array with 1D Gaussin function, rectangular, and triangular, and also it can fill discontinuities. In case of multi-constituents tehy have to initialize separately. More...

 Fill array with 1D gaussian shape This routine expects a 1D array, so multi-constituents have to be initialized separately.

 Fill array with rectanglar values This routine expects a 1D array, so multi-constituents have to be initialized separately.

 todo: Initialize the concentration fields with a step function

Detailed Description

Initial conditions for examples It can fill an array with 1D Gaussin function, rectangular, and triangular, and also it can fill discontinuities. In case of multi-constituents tehy have to initialize separately.

Function/Subroutine Documentation

subroutine example_initial_conditions.fill_discontinuity ( real(stm_real),dimension(nloc),intent(out)  vals,
integer,intent(in)  nloc,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  origin,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  dx,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  x0,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  value_lo,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  value_hi 
)

todo: Initialize the concentration fields with a step function

Parameters:
vals Values to be filled
nloc Size of array
origin Low side of channel
dx dx
x0 Location of discontinuity todo: ??
value_lo Value in the low side of discontinuity todo: ??
value_hi Value in the high side of discontinuity todo: ??

subroutine example_initial_conditions.fill_gaussian ( real(stm_real),dimension(nloc),intent(out)  vals,
integer,intent(in)  nloc,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  origin,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  dx,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  mean,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  sd,
real(stm_real),intent(in),optional  scale 
)

Fill array with 1D gaussian shape This routine expects a 1D array, so multi-constituents have to be initialized separately.

Parameters:
vals Values to be filled
nloc Number of cells (size of array)
origin Origin (lo side of channel)
dx dx
mean Center of the gaussian shape
sd Standard deviation (Sigma)
scale scale

subroutine example_initial_conditions.fill_rectangular ( real(stm_real),dimension(nloc),intent(out)  array,
real(stm_real),dimension(nloc),intent(in)  x,
integer,intent(in)  nloc,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  xlo,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  xhi,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  fill,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  fill_else 
)

Fill array with rectanglar values This routine expects a 1D array, so multi-constituents have to be initialized separately.

Parameters:
array Array to be filled
x Cell-centered x coordinate
nloc Size of array
xlo Lo side boundary of fill
xhi Hi side boundary of fill
fill Filled value between xlo and xhi
fill_else Filled value if not between xlo and xhi

subroutine example_initial_conditions.fill_triangular ( real(stm_real),dimension(nloc),intent(out)  array,
real(stm_real),dimension(nloc),intent(in)  xpos,
integer,intent(in)  nloc,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  xlo,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  xhi,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  vertex_hight,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  fill_else 
)

Fill array with symetric triangular shape (isosceles triangle) This routine expects a 1D array, so multi-constituents have to be initialized separately.

Parameters:
array Array to be filled
xpos Cell-centered x coordinate
nloc Size of array
xlo Lo side boundary of fill
xhi Hi side boundary of fill
vertex_hight Filled value of the toppest point
fill_else Filled value if not between xlo and xhi

real(stm_real) example_initial_conditions.gaussian_cdf ( real(stm_real),intent(in)  x0,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  mean,
real(stm_real),intent(in)  sd 
)

Gaussian cdf (integrated Guassian pdf) from -inf to x0.

Parameters:
x0 End of integration
mean Mean
sd Sigma (standard deviation)
